title: What's News: Business & Finance
text:
U.S. retail sales stalled in September as the nation's shoppers grappled with high inflation and rising interest rates.

Nikola founder Milton was convicted of securities fraud for what prosecutors said were repeated lies about the development of Nikola's trucks and technology.

Rupert Murdoch has proposed a recombination of Fox Corp. and News Corp nearly a decade after they split, according to people familiar with the situation.

U.S. stocks fell, the latest U-turn for markets in a volatile week. The S&P 500, Nasdaq and Dow lost 2.4%, 3.1% and 1.3%, respectively.

Apple retail workers in Oklahoma City voted to unionize, becoming the second group of employees at one of the company's U.S. stores to organize officially.

What's News: Business & Finance
